metadata.Title: CVE-2018-13097 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in fs/f2fs/super.c in the Linux kernel through 4.17.3. There is an out-of-bounds read or a divide-by-zero error for an incorrect user_block_count in a corrupted f2fs image, leading to a denial of service (BUG). Wen Xu discovered that the f2fs file system implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly validate metadata. An attacker could use this to construct a malicious f2fs image that, when mounted, could cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-13097` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-145-generic - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-lowlatency - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-145-generic - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-145-lowlatency - 4.4.0-145.171
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> fixing git commit subject: "f2fs: fix to do sanity check with user_block_count" tyhicks> The affected user base for this issue is likely small since f2fs is not the default filesystem and it is not widely used in Ubuntu
